intro: Palala mandaharan, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its vibrant yellow petals and intricate floral structure. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and requires well-drained soil to thrive. Its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from the forest floor, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to habitat loss, the Palala mandaharan is now considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
